fields.description:
Im planning a simple script which comments my pull-requests with the latest code coverage.\\
For this i need to know the pull-request id in order to post a comment through Bitbucket API 1.0.

It would be nice if theres an environment variable called "$BITBUCKET_PULLREQUEST" which contains the id of the pull-request. It should only be set if the current build is triggered through an updated pull-request.
fields.summary: Add $BITBUCKET_PULLREQUEST Environment Variable

fields.description:
Jira Team,

Found this issue in https://bitbucket.org/, we cannot uncheck "Pushed" checkbox in HipChat integration . Steps to reproduce

# Uncheck Pushed
# Click on Done
# Refresh page
# Pushed is again checked
fields.summary: Cannot uncheck "Commits--->Pushed" checkbox in HipChat integration

fields.description:
It would be great if Pipelines supported more operating systems than just Linux.  It would give Travis-using developers a strong incentive to switch to BitBucket.  FreeBSD, thanks to Jails, would probably be the easiest OS to add.  There are several Jail managers available for FreeBSD, for example:

https://github.com/iocage/iocage a popular native Jail manager, using ZFS clones.

https://github.com/kvasdopil/docker/tree/freebsd-compat port of Docker to FreeBSD, using ZFS.  It can also run some Linux images using Linux binary emulation

https://github.com/3ofcoins/jetpack An experimental implementation of the App Container Specification.
fields.summary: Support for FreeBSD in pipelines

fields.description:
I would like to revive the idea from Issue BCLOUD-7766 and propose that "yaml" be added to the list of repository language.

We are using bitbucket to version control our aws cloudformation templates in YAML.\\
Im sure we are not the only ones.

I feel that YAML and JSON should be valid options in the repository language options in Bitbucket.

An argument against this was made in 2013 saying that YAML was a Markup Language and not a real programming language, but so is Markdown, and it's in the list of options for Repository Language.
fields.summary: Add YAML and JSON and/or aws-cloudformation-template to repository language options

fields.description: Previously working links to images in markdown  on the wiki and the images themselves in the repository fail to open. The browser keeps claiming that "The page isn't redirecting properly".
fields.summary: Relative links to images not working

fields.description: When I click the checkbox, nothing happens, it doesn't become checked, which means I can't add any new tasks to pull requests.
fields.summary: Create task checkbox not working

fields.description: SVG images fail to render in restructured text files in the repo and only works by adding ? to the end of the URL.
fields.summary: SVG images fail to render in restructured text files in the repo.

fields.description:
With the new Bitbucket UI, whenever I go to Create Issue, instead of the cursor defaulting to the issue "Title" field, the focus is completely lost. I must click into the field first before I can begin typing.

I would prefer the cursor to be focused on the "Title" field on new issue creation.
fields.summary: Cursor not focused on "Title" with Issue Creation on the New Bitbucket UI

fields.description:
This feature request is related to issue BCLOUD-14143. This is my first Bitbucket feature request , so hopefully it's in the right place!

Currently, the web UI uses commit date everywhere, including:

* The date column when viewing a repository's commit history
* The date shown when viewing a specific commit

I've found that in many of my use cases, the author date is actually the more useful than the commit date. For example, when using a rebase-heavy workflow the author date gives you a much more accurate of how code was developed chronologically. When I view my commit history locally (using the standard command line client), ordering my author date makes it easier to keep track of which changesets are which.

Would it be possible to give users the option of viewing and ordering by author date in Bitbucket's UI? I understand this would be a matter of personal preference, so would this make sense as a Setting/Lab/Integration?
fields.summary: View commits by Author Date

fields.description:
Use Case: the Docker image that is used in my project's build is updated.\\
I'd like that event to automatically trigger a rebuild of my projects that depend on it.

Since BB has a "webhooks" feature for sending out event notices, I'm wondering whether there's or could be a receiver-side analog so that I can add my BB pipelines to receive webhook calls from Docker Hub .
fields.summary: pipelines: support kicking off pipeline via (receiving a callback via) webhook

fields.description:
I've checked in a bitbucket-pipelines.yml file to my project _before_ I enabled the pipelines feature for that project.  I've been combing the UI looking for a way to manually kick off the first build.

This feature is available on a per-commit basis: see Issue BCLOUD-12811 (resolved).\\
But I only have a vanilla default: build and can't figure out how to run it without doing a new commit.

Am I just missing seeing it?  And, if not, consider this a feature request.  Thx.
fields.summary: pipeline: run first time from ui

fields.description:
While relative links may have been fixed for images in markdown documents, it looks like this only works with Public repos: images still won't render for Private repos.

Indeed, grabbing the source url for an image and trying to open it in another tab, a url that points to bytebucket.org, the user is greeted with a login screen.
fields.summary: Images in Markdown format files don't appear for private repos

fields.description:
What I am looking for is something similar to the GitLab functionality:

*Merge commit with semi-linear history*

bq. A merge commit is created for every merge, but merging is only allowed if fast-forward merge is possible. This way you could make sure that if this merge request would build, after merging to target branch it would also build.  When fast-forward merge is not possible, the user is given the option to rebase.


As far as I can see, this is currently not possible to configure in Bitbucket. Further I would like a setting that I can use to enforce this in the UI.
fields.summary: Add option to only allow merge if fast-forward merge is possible

fields.description:
# Subscribe to issue notifications for a repository (under the "Watch" menu on the repository overview)
# Receive an email notification about an issue
# Click the "Unsubscribe from issue emails" link in the email
# Bitbucket opens with a 500, but if you check the "Watch" menu again you'll find you are indeed unsubscribed
fields.summary: "Unsubscribe from issue emails" link leads to a 500, but operation succeeds

fields.description:
For some reason the Side-by-Side Diff on a commit does not seem to work as per image the CSS seems to be incorrect,

Running Chrome 57.0.2987.133 at 1080p resolution

!318917370-bitbucket_fail.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Side-by-Side Diff view does not work in chrome

fields.description:
As of now, API 2.0 does not have the endpoint to use for updating issues that is previously available in 1.0

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/issues-resource-296095191.html#issuesResource-Updateanexistingissue
fields.summary: rest API endpoint for updating Issues

fields.description:
Hello!\\
It would be extremely helpful if pipelines will be triggered by Pull Request to the specified branch. For example, if have pull request from {{FEATURE-x}} branch to {{staging}}, pipelines should trigger build for {{staging}} branch.\\
Currently, there is no way to run tests in pipelines for internal PRs except of using "default" pipeline

Note: BCLOUD-13162 is related to PRs that was made from external repository.
fields.summary: Trigger pipelines when making PR

fields.description: The [guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/debug-your-pipelines-locally-with-docker-838273569.html] is missing instructions how to simulate an environment _with_ services.
fields.summary: Documentation for testing Pipeline services locally

fields.description:
These [instructions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/test-with-databases-in-bitbucket-pipelines-856697462.html] state that the mysql image exposes the 3306 via IPv4. When I used {{mysql:5.7}}, I found that this is not the case. It is only IPv6.\\
More examples in my [private repo|https://bitbucket.org/mobilejob/ci-test].
fields.summary: Documentation: No IPv4 connection to mysql pipeline service

fields.description: The new search drawer is great, but one thing that immediately confused me was the cross to clear your text search. Firstly, it looks like it should close the search drawer, and secondly it is visible and clickable when there is no text to clear. Its purpose would be much more instantly obvious if it were closer or more obviously linked to the search field, and if it only appeared once a query had been entered.
fields.summary: Search drawer "clear search" button is confusing

fields.description:
Please note that Forth words can also start with numbers.

The the following are all valid Forth words incorrectly classified by the the built-in syntax mode:

* 2pi
* 64K
* 2root2
fields.summary: Forth Syntax Enhancement

fields.description:
Hi,

I am trying to deploy angularjs app to aws ec2 by capistrano.

It needs pem file. but I don't want to add pem file to git repository.

Is there any way to upload pem file so as to use it on capistrano deploying.

Thank you.
fields.summary: can I deploy to production with pem file.

fields.description:
Would it be possible to add a date/time filter to the repo commits api?\\
Something like github has with "since" and "until" ([github link|https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/commits/])

(re\\
[bitbucket api doc|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%257Busername%257D/%257Brepo_slug%257D/commits#get])

Hello

Would wanted to understand whether it is possible to restrict Bitbucket repo using mac address.

If possible, please share the documentation to enable the same.

Thanks\\
Dinakar
fields.summary: Restrict Access using Mac Address

fields.description:
I'm creating a new issue for this problem since BCLOUD-14080 was marked as resolved, though it's still happening to me (and a lot of others from the comments).

Please don't force us to log in every day, this is a really bad experience and doesn't provide any value from a security perspective.  I don't use any similar internet apps that require me to log in every day, including competitors to BitBucket.
fields.summary: Getting logged out daily

fields.description:
I currently admin a team with 65 users.

47 of those users show up on our public profile page. I can not seem to figure out why certain users are showing up and certain users are not.

For privacy reasons, I need a way to be able to control who shows up on this public page. (I do not want to make the entire profile private)
fields.summary: Control which team members display on public team profile page

fields.description: In Stash (not Bitbucket Server), I would receive an email if my PR ended up with a conflict after another PR was merged.  I had a conflict happen recently in Bitbucket Cloud but did not receive and email notifying me of this.
fields.summary: Send email notification when a PR has a conflict

Steps:

# Create a new branch from the website

The workaround is to do this locally, but it would be nice to show a newly created branch visible when creating a file.
fields.summary: Creating new branch will not display when creating a new file on website

fields.description: If two pull requests are merged at the same time using the squash option, then it is possible that they will be in a race where one will win and the other will lose but both will report that they merged correctly. The squashed merge commit for the loser is not attached to the main branch.
fields.summary: Pull request reports that it is merged, but commit is lost when using squash merge

fields.description:

For example while in on-line edit mode:

* pressing the "Fork" icon
* etc.

causes all edits to be lost.

*Any action should first bring up a warning banner to confirm that edits will be lost!*
fields.summary: Warn when navigating away with unsaved changes

See attachment for screen.

Using Chrome 58 on OS X 10.11.6

Hello BitBucket team,

This is on behalf of my colleagu with login michal.kreslik@kgtinv.com as he cannot even create bug.

We are paying customers and this is completely preventing my colleague from his work - so please investigate with highest priority.

Some of our team mates received email about security breach (attached).\\
Some of them - luckily! - haven't reset the password yet. Michal Kreslik did, but whenever he tries he gets request error (attached). Also from that time he is unable to access bitbucket (login error attached).

Please keep us posted (with michal.kreslik@kgtinv.com in loop) and if possible give us some raw ETA on fix - as this is dirrectly preventing us from our current team work.

Thanks and regards\\

fields.description:
For example:

https://bitbucket.org/!api/2.0/repositories/atlassian/stash-auto-unapprove-plugin/pullrequests/21/diff?context=0

redirects to:

https://bitbucket.org/!api/2.0/repositories/atlassian/stash-auto-unapprove-plugin/diff/gsylviedavies/stash-auto-unapprove-plugin:acfeaf6dc2e7%0D37b3eed9d931

But drops the context=0 parameter.

This will break existing integrations that rely on any context parameters passed to the pull request diff end-point.

See screenshot below - tested on OSX:\\
!4143975196-safari9.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: New Side menu doesn't load properly on Safari 9.

fields.description:
ok so the general idea is to allow approving of individual files inside a pull request, say I have 10 files and I approve 5 of them, I will not have to re-review them in case of new commits.

the catch - if a developer pushes a new commit that affects a file I already approved, I'd want the approval to be removed so I will re-review it.

but as a start I'd be happy to see the option to approve individual files, regardless if they might change later (since at the moment the same logic applies at the global level of the pull request)
fields.summary: Ability to approve individual files

fields.description:
Squash merge strategy cause that pull requests lost references to squashed commits. I reckon that squash shouldn't affect records in Activity tab because these are important part of development history overview.

Imagine PR where collaborate more developers and each of them creates some commits. By using squash strategy, all these commits get lost (references to them, mentions in activity) and PR only refers to new single commit.

Both GitLab and GitHub preserve squashed commits and would be really nice and useful if Bitbucket did so as well.
fields.summary: Squashed commits should be preserved in PR

fields.description:
When a Bitbucket user account got deleted, timestamps of existing PRs are updated.

!1013800874-Pasted_Image_24_04_2017__11_17_AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: PR timestamp should not be updated when author of pull request removes his account
Mercurial push limit is indicated wrongly

fields.description:
New mercurial repositories when created are defaulting to "non-publishing repository" which is not even remotely the expected default behavior for most mercurial users. That is changes that are pushed are in _draft stage_.

This is particularly annoying since Bitbucket originally defaulted to "non-publishing" and now I have a bunch of new repositories with draft changes made my by continuous integration servers.

Mercurial is not Git. The default is supposed to be immutable history.
fields.summary: New Mercurial Repositories are defaulting to "non-publishing repository"

fields.description:
Because boldness of a font can change it's content height, syntax highlighting can make line numbers not line up to lines, since line numbers will never be bolded, and line numbers will only match if the content height of the lines of the content are as tall as the line numbers.

For example, on my Lubuntu system, the first source code font available from the given specifier on Bitbucket is Courier.

Line numbers do not add up to lines on this file (see screenshot):

https://bitbucket.org/progether/igd-health/src/master/modules/uke-portal-php/web/ops/i18n/client_en.properties

I noticed that you are using "font-weight: 700" on the equal signs in this file. Elements set in bold fonts versus normal fonts do not necessarily have the same content heights. See http://stackoverflow.com/a/8376913\\
On my Lubuntu system, from the font specifier you have ('Consolas,Menlo,"Liberation Mono",Courier,monospace'), only Courier is available.

You can see how that snippet appears in the attached screenshot. Note how the content height can differ even if the line-height and the font-size is the same.

I use Firefox 52.0.2 on Ubuntu 16.04 on a 96x96 DPI display running in vmware with the vmware display driver in X.org.

One proposed fix would be to absolutely position the lines or enforce their heights.
fields.summary: Line numbers do not line up
preinstall npm not running

This worked well in the past but it is currently no longer working. Here is our page for your reference: https://bitbucket.org/biobakery/biobakery/wiki/Home . Lauren

fields.description:
This has been an issue for awhile, but it used to be the case that highlighting the code would redraw the tabs all at the same width.  Highlighting no longer does this and the tab widths remain sporadically different throughout the code.

I'm using Safari 10.0.1.  Here's a screenshot of the issue. I highlighted starting from the first character (a space) after the tab on line 187 and ended the highlight to the (including) first tab on the next line (188).  I.e. All that's highlighted on line 188 is a single tab character and the first 2 characters on line 187 are a tab and a space and the highlight there includes the space.  You can see that the beginning of the highlight and end of the highlight don't line up and reflect the different in the asterisk placement on each of those lines.  *They should be perfectly aligned as both lines start with <tab><space><asterisk>.*

!1936833228-tab_width_varies_in_PR_diff2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Tab width varies in PR diff

fields.description: As far as I can tell, BitBucket pipelines always run on Ubuntu 14.04.  Docker containers can be used to simulate other Linux userlands, but they cannot change the kernel.  It would be fabulous if Pipelines could use other operating systems, like FreeBSD, OSX, Windows, or iOS.  Travis CI is probably pipelines' biggest competitor, and it only supports Linux and OSX.  if Pipelines supports more operating systems than Travis, that would be a powerful inducement for projects to switch to BitBucket.
fields.summary: Support building and testing on more operating systems

fields.description:

!148642840-Captura%20de%20Tela%202017-04-20%20a%CC%80s%2010.58.32.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:

However right-clicking on the file name and opening it in a new tab or window displays the diffs correctly.

Looks like maybe URL encoding of the percent signs is causing a problem?

(Possibly related to BCLOUD-3387 ?)

fields.description:
It would be useful to be able to comment on a pipelines build, eg. to claim responsibility or note why it failed, etc. Much like Bamboo.

A formal "claim" would be nice, eg. so it can be exposed on the main pipelines screen. But a simple comment would probably cover most use cases.

fields.description:
bq. When running a pipeline which has an error I will have a message like

# Path\FunctionalTest::testPageIsSuccessful with data set BCLOUD-0 ('/quotation/new')\\
Error: Cannot access empty property\\
./Path/FunctionalTest.php:22 <-- This is the link


The link redirects to\\
https://bitbucket.org/<user>/<Repo>/src/<Hash>/Path/FunctionalTest.php:22 (Which shows Error 404)\\
instead of\\
https://bitbucket.org/<user>/<Repo>/src/<Hash>/Path/FunctionalTest.php (Which is the location of the file)
fields.summary: Pipelines Log: Source file URL redirect to the incorrect path
Unable to update team repositories via the 1.0 API

fields.description:
As an administrator for my company I would like to be able to manage the accounts for our company.

This involves the entire lifecycle of the account. From creation and release to the user to deletion or disabling the user.

At this point you need to either have access to the e-mail of employee's or before they leave have in your procedures that you need to sit with them to have them change their password.

For a tool to be used by corporations I would expect usermanagement to be part of the solution offered.
fields.summary: Corporate account management

fields.description:
When viewing a directory of a repo in the Source view, there is one branch B that when selecting it, it will change to the branch A instead. A teammate also tried this and could reproduce the same issue. We tried in 2 different repos and in both there is a branch that when selecting it, the view won't change to that branch, it will change to a different branch.\\
This won't happen when viewing a file, only when viewing a directory. If I open a file in the Source view, and change from master to branch B, it will change to B; but doing this in a directory, it will change to A.\\
It only happens with one specific branch. In one repo, we have 6 branches and it there is only one that presents this behaviour. In another repo, we have 3 branches and only happens with one of them.

To reproduce this issue, I just select master, then select the branch B and it will change to branch A.
fields.summary: Cannot change to a specific branch when viewing a directory (BBCDEV-7853)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Pipelines email notification description is showing the name of the user who triggered the build, but not the actual author of the commit
 Based on our observation from the following email notification format, the <Name> field should disable the Commit author's name:
{code:java}
<WorkspaceID> / <Repo-Name>

<Build Status>	<Duration>
<Branch Name>
<Name> committed <commit-hash>
<commit message>
{code}
However, the current email notification is displaying the actor who triggered the build instead.
h3. Sample image
 # Commit Author(Grey Color)
 !Screen Shot 2021-02-01 at 4.22.46 pm.jpg|thumbnail!
 # After we run the multiple builds with a different account on the same commit, the Email Notifications showing two different users committed "3b49707"
 !Screen Shot 2021-02-01 at 4.22.30 pm.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce

(!) Please do ensure that the accounts had watched the repository in order to get an email notification
 * Add the following configuration to bitbucket-pipelines.yml to simulate a fail build
{code:java}
pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        script:
          - exit 1
{code}

 * Create a commit then navigate to the commit's page
 * Click "Run pipelines" to trigger the fail build
 * Login to a different account and access the same commit page
 * Click on "Run Pipelines" again to trigger builds
 * Check the email inbox

h3. Expected Results
The <Name> mentioned in email notification should remain as the "Commit Author", and not the actor who triggers the Pipelines build
{code:java}
<Commit Author(Grey)> committed 3b49707
test edited online with Bitbucket
{code}

h3. Actual Results
The <Name> mentioned in email notification displays the actor who triggers the Pipelines build
{code:java}
<Pipelines Actor> committed 3b49707
test edited online with Bitbucket
{code}

h3. Notes

If the email notification should show the Actor who triggers the build, the content of the email should update as following:
{code:java}
<Pipelines Actor> runs build on the commit 3b49707
test edited online with Bitbucket
{code}

h4. _Initial Description_
{quote}When I merge a PR and a pipelines fails, the email that is sent says I committed the failing commit.
 Which is not true, but I did add it to the repo.
{quote}
fields.summary: Email notification for build failure is not showing the correct commit author

fields.description:
I made a tag as a draft and then pushed it to my non publishing repo.

I did {{hg prune -r .}} to remove the tag, made some more commits

When I tried to {{push -B @}} it said I would push another head since {{@}} was the tag that was replaced.\\
This seems like a Mercurial bug.

In Bitbucket it still shows the tag even though when I clone the repo I don't have a .hgtags
fields.summary: Removed tags still show up

fields.description:
It would be really nice to have a way to disable automatic links creation for commits.

For example, if I put following text in a README.md file, a link will be automatically created:

68719476735

But that is not always a commit hash! It could be just a string or number.\\
Current behavior is specified [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/mark-up-comments-305037452.html#Markupcomments-LinkingtoBitbucketObjectsfromCommentsandCommitMessages].

Currently users are [forced|http://stackoverflow.com/a/27217693] to insert empty links after each 6 characters in string/number to prevent markdown from link creation.
fields.summary: Disable automatic links creation for commits

fields.description: "Repo activity is currently unavailable". Not able to see commits in Recent activity.
fields.summary: Recent activity not updating

fields.description: Not sure if what I want is a BB or Pipelines feature, but basically I'd love to be able to easily see the master build status in my PR before merging so we don't merge on red builds.
fields.summary: Master build status available next to my PR build status

fields.description:
There was an old request to add an ALL option to the repositories menu, but it wasn't particularly clear what the proposer was saying..

Is there a specific reason why the Repositories menu doesn't have a link to https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/repositories ? It would make the repos menu a lot more useful for me (as a particular class of forgetful user), as a one click way to get back to a list of all my relevant repos..

Sure, clicking the bucket icon to get to the dashboard, and then the repositories tab to get to https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/repositories is a relatively easy 2 click way of doing it, but it's not obvious that clicking the bucket in the top left takes you to your dashboard so I (as an infrequent user of BB) forget that path, and then struggle to find how to switch to a repo I haven't used recently..

I'm not taking exception to the number of clicks to get to https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/repositories - just to the fact that it's easy to forget where it is when it's "hidden" (due to it not being obvious that clicking the bitbucket logo goes to the dash).\\
The repos menu is right there and looks like an easy way to switch repo, but it (for me) is crying out for a link to all the repos, as would any "here's a list of X recently Y'd items" (and here's a link to all of them as the X+1 element) facility ina piece of  software
fields.summary: Repositories menu could link to "all repos" page in Dashboard?

fields.summary: Handle errors in UI when updating diff

However, if you go into the account and you will see that, the user has access to the group.

When the deleted Bitbucket account belongs to an author of a pull request, the summary view of the PR can be seen the name of the author turns to "*[Deleted user]*".

!2695574011-Pasted_Image_19_04_2017__10_08_AM.png|thumbnail!

Viewing the PR of the deleted Bitbucket account, the Author and Reviewer row is stacked as sample image below.

Hi,

is it possible to download my last build, after i pushed my repo?

Greets

This issue seems to happen most often with users who have existing Atlassian accounts and are signing up/logging in for the first time.

They will go through the login/signup ("Choose a username") process and then receive a 500 error.
fields.summary: Some users get a 500 error when logging in for the first time (BBCDEV-6329)

fields.description:
This issue link on PRs used to be a direct link to the jira issue, which I used all the time to go directly to the jira issue with a middle click. Now it opens the modal dialog, which is not very useful to me. It's reasonable to keep that for a normal click, but could this link change to open a new tab directly to the JIRA issue if I middle click on it?

!1384534192-Screen%20Shot%202017-04-18%20at%208.43.57%20AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA issue linker should allow middle click to go straight to JIRA

fields.description:
On a fork of a master repo when I created a branch on the fork and did some work and made a pull request to the master repo where i used the same branch name and set branch deletion to off.

Then for administrative purposes i was asked to change the target branch to a pre-made ui feature branch. I edited the pull request and changed the destination branch to the new branch on the master repo and clicked save changed. The target branch value was not updated and remained the same as the branch that was initially created.

To work around this i had to decline the original pull request and recreate it with the new target branch. This worked as expected.
fields.summary: Changing the target branch of a existing pull request and saving does not persist changes.

fields.description:
Currently, only build, tag and push commands are supported.

There are use cases to use *docker-run* so that tests can be run against a built Docker image and *docker create* so that files/artifacts can be extracted from the container.

Please comment with additional use cases.
fields.summary: Support running Docker containers (create, start, run) in the build script

fields.description: Builds that build and push Docker could be faster if the layers of the image were cached.
fields.summary: Cache Docker layers between builds

fields.description:
I spent few hours building a tool to generate git stats across all our company repositories by parsing all commits from Bitbucket APIs and storing them in DB then connecting it to BI tool to create any graphs.

The commit API json returns the following data about each commit

{code}
{
  "hash": "d566e1c3328809f1dde0123db183e403c2ca2c7c",
  "repository": {..},
  "links": {..},
  "author": {..},
  "participants": [],
  "parents": [],
  "date": "2016-04-02T13:40:04+00:00",
  "message": "Refactoring and code comments\n",
  "type": "commit"
}
{code}

Naturally, you would think {{date}} is the {{author date}} but ironically, it's the {{commit date}}!!! Why on earth would they return a single date and the one you choose isn't the {{author date}}?

This is the difference ([source|https://alexpeattie.com/blog/working-with-dates-in-git]):

bq. As the Pro Git Book explains: The author is the person who originally wrote the work, whereas the committer is the person who last applied the work. So if, for instance, you send in a patch to a project, the author date will be when you made the original commit but the committer date will be when the patch was applied.


Why is this important? because all modern devs don't push commits until they're ready. Usually any dev just commits changes atomically and then pushes them end of day or week or every few hours.

The problem is right now the stats shows people with over 60 commits per day when in reality they are distributed among several days.

How long will it take you guys to return both dates?
fields.summary: API should return both Author and Commit Date

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a Wiki page called "Test" and save it.
# Create a second page, or edit some other existing page.
# In the edit window of that page, type {{[Test](Test)}}
# Click the "Preview" button at the top right of the edit box
# Click the "Test" link on the preview pane

Result:

Clicking the "Test" link generates a 404.  (The link on the Preview pane is of the form {{https://bitbucket.org/user/project/src/df8d5ebbf1ef66bb2b12e9685e489b4907158a96/Test}})

Expected Result:

Clicking the "Test" link would take me to the "Test" page (i.e. the link would be of the form {{https://bitbucket.org/user/project/wiki/Test}})

Impact:

Likely only a problem for new users, as people will figure this out and move on.  But it's hard enough to figure out how you're supposed to format internal links to other wiki pages (I learned by trial and error--I didn't see instructions on this in any of the documentation), so it's probably not a good idea to have this additional barrier to learning by experimentation.
fields.summary: Links to other wiki pages do not work in Preview

fields.description:
When renaming the 'Team ID' (changing characters casing), for example uppercase to lowercase (TEAMNAME to teamname), the following error is displayed:

"An account with that name already exists."

An extra check should be implemented to see if the current account is requesting this change and allow it in this case.
fields.summary: Cannot change casing of team ID characters

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a Team account
# Create a group on the team account
# Add a user to one of the groups with you
# Create a repo and make one commit - even creating a Readme file in the UI works
# Go that that commit on the repo and mention the user you added by using a @ username
# go to the team Settings -> find that group and remove this user from the group, then review all other groups to make sure he is not lingering anywhere
# Go back to the same commit and mention that same user you just removed by @ username -> the user will comeup and will show up as a Teammate on the label next to him

Desired behavior:  after removing a user from all the group -> the user shouldn't come up on Commits or pull requests on that team when mentioning by @ username, because he is no longer a member
fields.summary: When user is removed from the Team and all the groups, mentioning that user by @ username still brings them up and labels as a teammate

fields.description:
We have a repo that is just over 1GB, one day we'll be able to split it up until that day we currently see the "This repository's size is over 1 GB. If it reaches 2 GB, we'll restrict the repository to read-only access." warning on every single page load. It's pretty annoying having to dismiss this to do things like Approve, Merge, Edit, or Decline a PR.

Could the message dismissal be tied to the session? Or maybe not show up on every single page?
fields.summary: Add ability to disable repo size warning message after seeing it once

fields.description:
I have the very same problem mentioned on Issue BCLOUD-13738

I tried this configuration, but the pipeline is never triggered.

{code}
#!yml

 pipelines:
   tags:
     v*:
       - step:
           script:
            - echo "ciao"
{code}

What am I doing wrong?
fields.summary: Build not triggered by tags

fields.description:
In our company, we're having some internal discussion about using the Wiki in BitBucket instead of using Confluence. The main reason being that Confluence breaks up the workflow a little bit, and it's not comfortably accessible.

The feature I'd like to add is adding a more user-friendly WYSIWIG option, that a user could just type text with formatting -- just as they do in Confluence, but in BitBucket's Wiki section. We have some team members that don't know Markdown, and it would be a bit of a chore to have them switch to using it.
fields.summary: BitBucket Wiki Feature Request - WYSIWYG

fields.description:
# Do a "Side-by-Side Diff"
# Left side shows a difference
# Right side renders nothing

This is an issue isolated to version of Chrome Version 57.0.2987.133 (64-bit) on Mac.

Resolution:\\
This is an CSS Issue with {{margin: 0 8px 0 8px}} for the {{<div class="diffract diffract-sbsdiff">}}. When it's removed, the side by side differences screen renders fine on both sides.
fields.summary: Side by side Differences for PR is not rendering - requires CSS code adjustment

fields.description:
bq. An API request with Authorization and token_type "bearer" - "Authorization: bearer ...." fails\\
With the same request using token_type "Bearer" (with a capital B) - "Authorization: Bearer ......" succeeds


bq. The problem is caused in the "oauth2/access_token" request. The request returns an invalid "token_type" with lowercase 'b', which is not working as the previous 2 request proved.

Sample OAuth output:\\
{"access_token": ".............", "scopes": "........", "expires_in": 3600, "refresh_token": "........", "token_type": "bearer"}


Suggested solution:

# The authentication should allow OAuth2 tokens with "Authorization: Bearer" and "Authorization: bearer"  _or_
# The "oauth2/access_token" should return the correct "token_type": "Bearer" with capital B
fields.summary: Change authorization header to case insensitive header

fields.description:
On the commits and pull requests pages, there is a list (links) of changed files followed by a text-display for each changed file. The text changes are always shown in inline view. This can become very difficult to sort through. The application does provide a side-by-side comparison feature, but the user has to click each code change to view the side-by-side changes, making this feature very cumbersome.

Add a feature to allow user to choose his default review code display. The options would be inline or side-by-side comparison. The text would show up in the webbrowser; the user would not have to click a link to show the text changes in a separate window.

I find it MUCH easier to review code side-by-side. The current implementation in Bitbucket is time consuming for reviewing code side-by-side. The ability to show code side-by-side is already implemented, but isn't shown IN the webpage. The side-by-side view is already used by AWS, thus I would expect that this feature would be relatively simple to implement.
fields.summary: Bitbucket enhancement: Allow user to review code side-by-side as a default view.

fields.description:
Allow user to show/hide text changes to files on the Commits and Pull Requests pages.

On the commits and pull requests pages, there is a list (links) of changed files followed by a text-display for each changed file. The text changes are usually shown when the page loads, but sometimes the file comparison section starts out not showing the code comparison text (it says "too much information for web page to display"). There is a link to click that opens the comparison for individual file comparisons, but no link to close/hide the display.

I would want a link to be added that allows the user to close/hide individual text file comparison sections, instead of it being hidden only on the initial load of the page, and only if there is too much text to display.

It would seem that half of this feature is already there (since it hides the code if there is too much for the webpage to download). I thus expect that this would be fairly easy to implement.
fields.summary: New Bitbucket Feature: Allow user to "hide" file/code comparisons.

fields.description:
Company password to SVN expired, new one was created. I did not get any GUI prompt to change the password in SourceTree. Trying a pull/fetch request would run indefinitely.\\
Using git to SVN.

Observed in visible log of the locked up pull request. It would never pass these lines.\\
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false svn fetch\\
Authentication realm: [https://ny-svn.somewebsite.com:443] CollabNet Subversion Repository

Running the terminal command "git svn fetch" prompted a password dialog.\\
After that, it worked.\\
I would expect the GUI to popup for a password failure.
fields.summary: Add a prompt to SourceTree GUI when a new password for SVN was created or a password failure message

fields.description:
In the same vein as BCLOUD-3674, it would be good to be able to indicate appreciation for a specific comment on an issue, to avoid low value posts that contain little more than +1.

So basically [Github's reactions|https://github.com/blog/2119-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments], with the same rationale, but I would implement it a little differently. Let each user have one reaction, which could be any [emoji|https://bitbucket.org/DACOFFEY/wiki/wiki/BITBUCKET/EMOJI/Emoji]. A list of emoji would appear at the bottom of a comment, sorted by number of reactions. Clicking the emoji would show usernames. In the odd case where there are lots of reactions, the tail of lesser used emoji could be elided, limiting to a single row of graphics.

While less can sometimes be more, I think Github's choice of emoticons is poor. I could settle for just two, one positive and one negative, if allowing all seems uncouth.
fields.summary: Upvoting or "plus one" button for comments on issues.

fields.description: I commented on a bug that two others were discussing. One name started with B and the other with C. I would expect to only have to type {{@B}} and autocomplete the rest of B's name, but I had to type most of his name. Autocomplete really should search the narrow scope of the comment thread for names before suggesting all other Bitbucket users in the world.
fields.summary: Participants in issue thread should be at the top of username autocomplete list.

fields.description:
Multiple top-level headings are being rendered as H2 instead of H1 elements when using reStructuredText:

{code}
#!rst
1-1 expected-H1-got-H2
======================
1-2 expected-H2-got-H3
----------------------
2-1 expected-H1-got-H2
======================
2-2 expected-H2-got-H3
----------------------
{code}

gets rendered as:

h2. 1-1 expected-H1-got-H2
h3. 1-2 expected-H2-got-H3
h2. 2-1 expected-H1-got-H2
h3. 2-2 expected-H2-got-H3
----
A single top-level heading show expected behavior:

{code}
#!rst
1-1 expected-H1-got-H1
======================
1-2 expected-H2-got-H2
----------------------
1-2 expected-H2-got-H2
----------------------
{code}

gets rendered as:

h1. 1-1 expected-H1-got-H1
h2. 1-2 expected-H2-got-H2
h2. 1-2 expected-H2-got-H2
----
Markdown shows expected behavior in both cases:

{code}
#!md
#  1-1 expected-H1-got-H1
## 1-2 expected-H2-got-H2
#  2-1 expected-H1-got-H1
## 2-2 expected-H2-got-H2
{code}

----
{code}
#!md
#  1-1 expected-H1-got-H1
## 1-2 expected-H2-got-H2
## 1-2 expected-H2-got-H2
{code}
fields.summary: reStructuredText: multiple top-level headings render as H2 instead H1

fields.description:
Sorting the pull request overview "feed" by recent activity will improve usability.

If someone responds to my comment, I have to scroll all the way down to the comment's *original* position in activity feed. I can't even {{CTRL+F}} to find it since the feed lazy loads. So, I end up mashing {{END}} until I hit the bottom of the feed. Then I {{CTRL+F}} to find a comment. But if replying to a comment or editing one made its whole thread appear at the top of the feed, I could spend more time actually reviewing prs instead of managing them.

If I add a comment on someone else's pr, I have to send them a link to the comment when they've forgotten about it. If the feed were sorted by recent activity, though, I could just reply to my own comment (e.g. "Reminder to look at this."), which would make that whole thread appear at the top of overview feed.
fields.summary: Sort Pull Request Overview By Recent Activity

fields.description: It will be just grate if images with node.js will support yarn too.
fields.summary: Support yarn
dotnet restore fail on bitbucket pipeline

fields.description:
In the example, [Merge+checks|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Merge%2Bchecks], on Develop branch, either Alana, Harvey or developers group can give minimum 2 approvals and perform the merge.

However, there isn't an option to enforce that either Alana or Harvey *must* have an approval, as the developers themselves can provide the approval and perform the pull request merge.

It'd be great if we can have a new condition where certain users must approve before the merge.
fields.summary: Require approval by specific users on merge check

fields.description:

When I receive a "Session expired" message, the page is completely broken and I need to refresh.

*Actual behaviour:*

The page appears to work fine, but the message is still displayed.

http://imgur.com/a/xHq1m
fields.summary: "Session expired" message, but page continues to work

fields.description: I searched nearly the whole site, but found email diff service has been removed with the service integrations. Is it really gone or hiding somewhere? Will it be added back again?
